messages.content:
Categorize this IT Ticket:

special leave has been assigned to am oracle hr support incident special leave assigned hi could you please raise ticket for request closing ticket resolved best regards applications analyst en sent tuesday december re incident special leave assigned thank you sent tuesday december re incident special leave assigned hi your request approved by should be queue although request was waiting for approval did reach was able open submit absence generated notification after being submitted by could you investigate why thank you lead sent tuesday december re incident special leave assigned hi your absence request goes your representative only after approves goes your line manager can you please confirm you received special leave request december best regards applications analyst en sent tuesday december incident special leave assigned please be advised record number assigned please review details take appropriate action description special leave hello line manager cannot special leave request for she cannot approve can you please check why thank you manager summary special leave number priority moderate assignment location access incident please click following link attachments image image kind regards ref msg

message.reasoning:

**Delving into HR Ticket Details**

I'm now zeroing in on the "HR Support" category, given the prevalence of "special leave" and absence request terminology. The context emphasizes workflows, approvals, and communication within the HR system, solidifying "HR Support" as the dominant category. I'm noting the recurring patterns and language, which will be crucial for automated categorization.


**Categorizing Leave Requests**

My assessment strongly points towards "HR Support" as the appropriate category. The recurring phrase "special leave" and its association with absence requests and approval workflows are the key indicators. The provided text consistently revolves around HR system interactions and processes, making "HR Support" the most logical choice.
